paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: varied ages and sexes, specific ethnicities not mentioned

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with cardiac amyloidosis at age 52.
Patient P2 presented with arrhythmias and was diagnosed at age 61.
Patient P3 was evaluated at age 58 but showed no symptoms.

individual_records.phenotype_details: heart failure and reduced ejection fraction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P4 was diagnosed with heart failure at age 64.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays indicated that the p.Thr40Met variant leads to destabilization of the TTR tetramer.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance data suggests a significant risk of developing symptoms with age.
key_quotes: The penetrance of the TTR p.Thr40Met variant is approximately 40% by age 70.
In families with this variant, 4 out of 10 carriers were affected.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of TTR variants and their clinical significance.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding TTR variants and penetrance were successfully extracted.
